meanings.definition: To cause confusion or make unclear.
meanings.sent1: The complicated instructions were befogging the students.
meanings.sent2: The thick fog was befogging the view of the mountains.
meanings.sent3: The magician's befogging trick left the audience scratching their heads.
meanings.sent4: Her tears were befogging her vision, making it hard to see.
meanings.sent5: The dense smoke from the fire was befogging the entire room.

meanings.definition: To obscure or cloud with fog or mist.
meanings.sent1: The morning mist befogging the fields created a mystical atmosphere.
meanings.sent2: The smoke from the bonfire was befogging the entire campsite.
meanings.sent3: The befogging fog made it impossible to find our way back home.
meanings.sent4: The memories of the past were befogging her mind, clouding her judgment.
meanings.sent5: The steam rising from the hot soup was befogging the kitchen window.
